definition.para: The spatial characteristics of the resource; refers to a physical region.

instructions.para: Enter broad and local geographic locations given significant attention in the resource.
Forms of the names should be derived from the LC Authority File.
For neighborhoods or other types of locales below the city level, enter an LCSH heading in the Subjects (LCSH) field above.
Separate multiple entries with a semicolon .
Enter broad and local geographic locations given significant attention in the resource.
Places names are derived from the LC Authority File.
For neighborhoods or other types of locales below the city level, enter an LCSH heading in the Subjects (LCSH) field above.
Separate multiple entries with a semicolon .

example.para: Croatia--Zagreb [use current form, even though Yugoslavia was the name when the photo was taken]
Russia (Federation)--Leningradskaia oblast--Saint Petersburg [use current form, even though it was called Leningrad in Soviet Union, when photo was taken]
Croatia--Zagreb [use current form, even though Yugoslavia was the name when the photo was taken]
Russia (Federation)--Leningradskaia oblast--Saint Petersburg [use current form, even though it was called Leningrad in Soviet Union, when photo was taken]

admin.para: SC Photographs collections DD uses the label "Location Depicted." SC Oral Histories DD uses the label "Geographic Coverage." Both properties appear to be equivalent.

history.justification: We wanted a property dedicated to describing the location depicted in an image.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

Added property description from the SC Oral Histories Data Dictionary and cleaned up some ambiguous language; the idea was to merge all geographic coverage info under one property "Location Depicted."
